name: NHR Frequent Update Manager | Hide Frequent Update Notices
author: Nazmul Hasan Robin

sections.description:
Getting too many updates from plugins? Well, say no to unnecessary frequent updates. Get updates whenever you want (e.x. once monthly) and Enjoy!

<?php echo 'Less Update, Enjoyable Life!'; ?>

Streamline Your WordPress Dashboard Updates

Are you overwhelmed by the constant flood of update notices in your WordPress dashboard? Introducing NHR Frequent Update Manager, the solution to help you maintain a clutter-free dashboard by intelligently managing update notifications.

üõ†Ô∏è Effortless Update Management

With NHR Frequent Update Manager, you can say goodbye to endless update notifications. The plugin automatically hides update notices after a certain period, allowing you to focus on your work without distractions.

üé® Flexible Configuration

Easily customize the update notification duration to suit your preferences. Use our simple filter to adjust the timeframe for hiding notices. Whether you prefer updates every week, month, or any other interval, NHR Frequent Update Manager gives you the flexibility to tailor it to your needs.

‚è±Ô∏è Improved Productivity

By minimizing unnecessary update notifications, NHR Frequent Update Manager helps you maintain a clutter-free dashboard, allowing you to concentrate on essential tasks and content creation without interruptions.

üöÄ Lightweight and Efficient

NHR Frequent Update Manager is designed with performance in mind. The plugin operates seamlessly in the background, ensuring minimal impact on your website’s speed and performance.
sections.installation:
Upload the NHR Plugin Update Manager plugin to your blog, activate it.

1, 2, 3: You’re done!
sections.faq:
Does it remove WordPress admin notices?

No. It hides plugin update notices for a certain time period. E.x. If you want to get updates in the first week of each month
then it wont display plugin update notices on the other weeks.

Does it require any other plugin

No. It works as standalone plugin.

How does NHR Frequent Update Manager work?

NHR Frequent Update Manager intelligently manages update notifications in the WordPress dashboard by automatically hiding them after a specified period (default 7 – means first 7 days of each month update notices will be visible). This helps users maintain a clutter-free dashboard experience.

Can I customize the duration for hiding update notifications?

Yes, NHR Frequent Update Manager offers flexible configuration options.
Users can easily adjust the timeframe for hiding update notices according to their preferences using a simple filter provided by the plugin.
Filter: nhrrob_frequent_update_manager/allowed_days (Default value: 7)

Is NHR Frequent Update Manager compatible with all WordPress themes and plugins?

Yes, NHR Frequent Update Manager is built to be compatible with most WordPress themes and plugins.
The plugin operates seamlessly in the background, minimizing the risk of conflicts with other extensions.
